prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: GAMA9
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: HATLAS GAMA 9h field. 4 sources for this 'science target'.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
REQUESTED SENSITIVITY
The goal of the proposal is to 230GHz continuum and CO(6-5) observations of redshift z=2 far-infrared bright quasars. We request a 5sigma sensitivity of 0.2 mJy across a 7.5GHz band, i.e. 1sigma rms = 0.04 mJy. This corresponds to a far-infrared luminosity of 7x10^11 Lsun (assuming a modified blackbody spectral energy distribution with T = 40K and beta=1.5). This corresponds to about 11 min on source integration time. For four sources in the H-ATLAS GAMA 9h field, The total time request is about 1.3 hours. At this sensitivity the 1sigma rms per 100 km/s is 0.4 mJy, meaning that for a 300 km/s we would be able to obtain a 4sigma detection of a 3x10^9 K km/s pc2 CO(6-5) line.
IMAGING REQUIREMENTS
We request an angular resolution of 0.5 arcsec. For a z=2 source this corresponds to a spatial scale of 4 kpc. This resolution is required to be able to distinguish between emission coming from the center of the quasar host galaxy, across the host galaxy, or from outside the host galaxy at a distance larger than 10 kpc. We do not expect the individual sources to be extended on scales larger than 0.2 arcsec.
CORRELATOR SETUP
We request a frequency setup in Band 6 using FDM, dual polarization. The four basebands are selected to be 1875MHz wide in order to both facilitate the continuum observations as well as provide as frequency coverage for the CO line. The exact frequency setup is governed by the predicted for observed frequency for the redshift CO(6-5) line of all four sources.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: GAMA12
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: HATLAS GAMA 12h field. 2 sources for this 'science target'.

We request a frequency setup in Band 6 using FDM, dual polarization. The exact frequency setup is governed by the predicted for observed frequency for the redshift CO(6-5) line of both sources.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: GAMA14-2
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: HATLAS GAMA 14h field. 2 sources for this 'science target'.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: Super-massive black holes (SMBHs) are ubiquitous in the centers of spheroidal galaxies, and their masses are correlated with the bulge mass, suggesting a coeval evolution. Far-infrared luminous quasars are the ideal candidates to better understand the SMBHs and starbursts connection. Recent results based on high resolution mm/CO imaging have revealed that the starburst related to FIR luminous QSO has several different origins. It could entirely take place in the central part of quasar host galaxy. Or it could be contributed by multiple sources in a gas-rich merger system. Another possibility is the "wet-dry" merger case that the starburst could be mainly contributed by a nearby companion galaxy. Here we propose an ALMA cycle-2 study of 10 FIR luminous optically selected QSOs at redshift z~2 in the Herschel-ATLAS GAMA fields. With the superior combination of sensitivity and spatial resolution of ALMA, we can address several key questions: Where does the starburst related to these quasars take place? Are the gas-rich and "wet-dry" merger common as predicted by cosmological simulations?
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Cosmology and the High Redshift Universe
